segments.text: I see the woman standing in the puddle, completely unfazed by the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost funny how oblivious she is to the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so sneaky, trying to grab cookies without getting caught.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy’s stool wobbling, and it makes me nervous just looking at it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share like it’s the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be in for a big surprise when she finally looks down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just cascading over the sink, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the children even care about the mess they’re making.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a comedy of errors waiting to unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman turns around before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR
